Object Type Taxonomy

Categorization of all game elements by their representational forms

Every element in D&D can be represented as one or more object types. This taxonomy defines how game elements map to physical and digital representations.

Sheets (Character Records)

Persistent records that track attributes, resources, and state:

Sheet TypeExamplesSRD Count
Character SheetsPlayer characters with abilities, HP, inventory—
Creature SheetsMonster stat blocks, NPCsMonsters compendium
Spell SheetsSpell descriptions with components, duration322 spells
Item SheetsEquipment with properties, weight, cost550 items
Class SheetsClass features, progression tables12 classes
Species SheetsRacial traits, abilities6 species

Dice (Random Number Generation)

Mechanisms for generating randomness and uncertainty:

Dice TypeUsageSystems
d4Weapon damage, spell damageDaggers, Magic Missile
d6Common damage die, Hit DiceShortswords, Rogues, Falling
d8Medium weapon damage, Hit DiceLongswords, Clerics
d10Heavy weapon damage, Hit DiceGlaives, Fighters
d12Great weapon damage, Hit DiceGreataxe, Barbarians
d20All ability checks, saves, attacksD20 Tests system
d100Percentile rolls, random tablesWild Magic, Treasure
Hit DiceRecovery during Short Rest1d6 to 1d12 based on class

Cards (Individual Game Elements)

Discrete elements that can be drawn, revealed, or played:

Card TypeExamplesSRD Count
Spell CardsIndividual spell descriptions for quick reference322 spells
Item CardsMagic items, equipment550 items
Condition CardsStatus effects (Blinded, Charmed, etc.)15 conditions
Feature CardsClass features, racial traitsVaries by class
Magic Deck CardsDeck of Illusions (34 cards), Deck of Many Things (22 cards)2 decks
Initiative CardsCombat turn order trackingCombat system

Hands (Collections Held by Players)

Private collections of cards or elements controlled by a player:

Hand TypeContainsSystem
Prepared SpellsSpells a caster has prepared for the daySpellcasting system
Known SpellsSpells a caster knows (Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock)Spellcasting system
Drawn CardsCards drawn from Deck of Many ThingsMagic items
Active FeaturesCurrently usable class/racial featuresVaries by class

Decks (Ordered Collections)

Organized collections that can be shuffled, drawn from, or searched:

Deck TypeExamplesSRD Count
Magic Item DecksDeck of Illusions, Deck of Many Things2 decks
Spell DeckAll spells available to a classVaries by class
Treasure DeckRandom loot generationItems compendium
Encounter DeckRandom monsters or eventsDM tools
Condition DeckAll possible status effects15 conditions

Boards (Spatial Representations)

Two-dimensional spaces for positioning and movement:

Board TypePurposeSystem
Battle MapGrid for tactical combat (5-foot squares)Combat, Movement
Dungeon MapExploration tracking, room layoutsExploration
World MapOverland travel, navigationTravel Mode
Initiative TrackerTurn order visualizationCombat system

Creatures (Living Entities)

Autonomous or controlled entities with stats and actions:

Creature TypeExamplesSRD
Player CharactersAdventurers controlled by players6 species, 12 classes
MonstersHostile, neutral, or friendly NPCsMonsters compendium
NPCsNon-player characters with stat blocksMonsters compendium
SummonsCreatures summoned by spells (Find Familiar, Conjure Animals)Spells & Monsters
CompanionsAnimal companions, familiars, steedsMonsters, Mounts
IllusionsIllusory creatures (Deck of Illusions)Spells, Magic items

Objects (Physical Items)

Tangible items that can be carried, used, or interacted with:

Object CategoryTypesExamples
WeaponsMelee (M), Ranged (R)Dagger, Longsword, Longbow (550 items)
ArmorLight (LA), Medium (MA), Heavy (HA), Shields (S)Leather, Chain Mail, Plate (550 items)
ToolsArtisan Tools (AT), Gaming Sets (GS), Kits (T)Thieves' Tools, Dice Set (550 items)
Adventuring GearGeneral (G)Rope, Torch, Backpack (550 items)
Magic ItemsWands (WD), Rings (RG), Rods (RD), WondrousWand of Magic Missiles (550 items)
ConsumablesPotions (P), Scrolls (SC), Food (FD)Potion of Healing (550 items)
Spellcasting FociArcane (SCF), Divine symbolsAmulet, Crystal, Wand (550 items)
Trade GoodsMaterials (TG)Canvas, Iron (550 items)
VehiclesMounts (MNT), Ships (SHP), Land (VEH)Horse, Galley, Wagon (550 items)
Tack & HarnessSaddles, Barding (TAH)Riding Saddle, Exotic Saddle (550 items)

Locations (Environmental Contexts)

Settings and environments where gameplay occurs:

Location TypePurposeSystems
DungeonsEnclosed exploration environmentsExploration Mode
WildernessOutdoor exploration and travelTravel Mode, Environmental Effects
SettlementsTowns, cities for social interactionInteraction Mode
Combat ArenasBattlefields, encounter areasCombat Mode
Planes of ExistenceOther dimensions, magical realmsSpells, Monsters
Special LocationsRooms with hazards, traps, effectsEnvironmental Effects, Traps

Cross-Reference: Object Types by System

Combat System Uses:

  • Sheets: Creature stats, HP tracking
  • Dice: d20 for attacks, damage dice
  • Cards: Initiative cards, condition cards
  • Boards: Battle map with grid
  • Creatures: Player characters, monsters
  • Objects: Weapons, armor, magic items
  • Locations: Combat arena, terrain features

Spellcasting System Uses:

  • Sheets: Spell descriptions, spell slots
  • Dice: Spell attack rolls, spell damage
  • Cards: Individual spell cards
  • Hands: Prepared spells, known spells
  • Decks: Class spell list
  • Objects: Spellcasting foci, material components

Exploration System Uses:

  • Dice: Perception checks, Investigation checks
  • Boards: Dungeon map, tracking explored areas
  • Creatures: Party members, encountered monsters
  • Objects: Adventuring gear, tools
  • Locations: Rooms, corridors, chambers

Implementation Notes

In digital implementations (like Foundry VTT):

  • Sheets → Document types (Actor, Item, JournalEntry)
  • Dice → Roll formulas and dice roller UI
  • Cards → Foundry Cards system or Item documents
  • Hands → Player-owned card collections
  • Decks → Card stacks, compendium packs
  • Boards → Scene with grid, fog of war
  • Creatures → Actor documents with tokens
  • Objects → Item documents
  • Locations → Scene documents, JournalEntry locations

The core concepts (dice, cards, etc.) are applied through relational properties in rules and systems, allowing flexible representation across physical and digital play.
